newsitem.title: USA: Denver Airport reports 2.9 pct rise in Nov cargo.
newsitem.headline: Denver Airport reports 2.9 pct rise in Nov cargo.

text.p: November cargo traffic at Denver International Airport rose 2.9 percent to 74.9 million pounds despite a slight reduction in freight and express traffic carried on all-cargo airlines and integrated carriers.

The Denver Airport Authority, operator of DIA, said passenger airlines carried 6.2 percent more freight and mail than in November 1995. United Airlines, which accounts for 40 percent of all DIA cargo, raises its volume by 10.8 percent to 27.1 million pounds.
Passenger airlines handle 49.2 percent of all DIA freight.

The Denver authority reported that all-cargo airlines carried 0.2 percent less cargo. FedEx, the airport's largest all-cargo operator by far, carried 15.9 million pounds, down 7.8 percent from November 1995. UPS, which holds the Number 2 position, raised its volume 9.0 percent to 10.1 million pounds.
